problem.title: The academic search shouldn’t feel like a maze
points: Unfocused cold emails aren’t helpful for professors or students.
Global opportunities are hard to compare across sites and languages.
Endless tabs, inconsistent formats, and scattered contacts waste months.
pains: Hard to match interests to research themes
Hours of manual profile checks per university
Guesswork on email patterns and contact details
No single shortlist to compare across labs/countries

solution.title: Smarter discovery through automation
solution.subtitle: Parse faculty pages into structured profiles with topics and contact signals, then match, shortlist, and outreach — with privacy by design.
benefits: Private shortlists with tags, notes, and export
On-page extraction of names, departments, research areas

items.q: Does it work with any university website?
items.a: It works on most faculty and ranking pages. On unusual layouts, you’ll still see a basic extraction.
We surface academic email pattern signals from public pages and official directories. You choose what to export.
